3_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK.body:
> [blurhy](#comment_21_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): The data of 0list and others is not enough for the search engine,i think

If you find links on the sites it is linking to, i think you may discover maybe more than double number of sites For example GFWTalk is large forum that can contain many external links.. In the sidebar of the **[Important Zites](/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E)** the @krixano made a search in ZeroUp and ZeroMe also.

1 . > [blurhy](#comment_22_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): The data maybe huge.
is it a problem? What about using merger sites to distribute data across multipe sites/DBs?

2 . Another thing is, when i search for "nettalk", it shows two entries both for same site, one .bit one standard address, may be handy to keep only one link (i prefer standard address as .bit can expire).

3 . Another think is that nettalk search query returned a topic URL which is nice, but apparently it does not find topics from ZeroTalk? Can you add ZeroTalk?

4 . Next think, the URLs are light green color, to better see it, it can be in darker green so there is bigger contrast

@blurhy
When you add this search query: create zeronet site -zerosecurity
you see alot of irrelevant results, it can be handy to allow user use the operators like exclusion (-zerosecurity)
Next thing that would help user filter the results is to allow requiring exact phrase which have to exist, example query:
+"create site" OR "make a website" +zeronet +tutorial -zerosecurity

(same syntax that most popular search engine - Google is using)
This would greatly help user to filter out exactly what is needed.

> [blurhy](#comment_29_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): @ssdifnskdjfnsdjk Do you mean distributed crawling.

yes, relying to one person to run some computer in order to supply new content for the SE (search engine) is not ideal, you probably know it (single point of failure)

Better if more people can contribute their computers to crawling (decentralization). Someone mentioned if making a zeronet plugin would not be solution.
OR distributed way of crawling (i am not a programmer to know if you already do it or if that will be possible)

10_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu.body: To login, one have to **[download PeerMessage plugin](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/Plugin-PeerMessage/archive/master.zip)** and after extracting to the plugins folder (on WIndows in ZeroNet/core/plugins/) restart Zeronet. **[More info](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/1535624559)**.

1547103330_1Q2C6xA6oZPUYoaviepNeJEcCeM8U.body:
@xialvjun This is interesting new project. Seems similar to [ZeroTorrent](/192dZ1EG5tU7PnCfuwGMDEBrr2eLqvs4t3) and i think it has same issue. Majority of indexed torrents/IPFS files will not be available/seeded as time will go and there is no decentralized mechanism to automatically remove long time unseeded files. But StarGate apparently allows any user to remove content of other users.

ISSUES:
Question is can i remove the entry if the IPFS is unable to download file for me due to lack of peers? Is it just temporary lack of peers or it will never get peers?
If user is allowed to remove any content, site is vulnerable to be emptied if someone is bored and create some removal bot.

IDEAS TO IMPROVE:
You can improve the site by using bigger icons that are more easily accessible or showing the hash right in search results for quicker accessibility, maybe even make hash clickable for copying to clipboard easily.

After copying there will be countdown timer creating cookie. And if user sees he is unable to download content for lets say 5 minutes, he can vote for dead file. If there are 2 votes from 2 users, file gets deleted?

Show the number of indexed hashes. limit number of results shown.
When i click download icon next to a file, the Firefox 64 developer console shows:
Content Security Policy: The page‚Äôs settings blocked the loading of a resource at http://localhost:8080/ipfs/QmYwAPJzv5CZsnA625s3Xf2nemtYgPpHdWEz79ojWnPbdG (‚Äúframe-src‚Äù).

on [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1D6QfsBSZHmYWbuCxKG5ya31BiTczoZiES/holmplasticdiesel/holmplasticdiesel.html) subpage when you hover mouse over the article title, you see the link is wrong

@mg0: once You are sure the site structure (links) will remain as is, you may try to create kind of sitemap with names of your site articles and links to them and add this as a zerotalk topic or such so the ZeroNet's search feature (located on [ZeroHello](/)) can be used to find these topics and people this way know they can find these articles on your site.
\[Article name or its description\](linkhere)
\[Article name or its description\](linkhere)
It is like with Google, one have to link to his site from other (well indexed) sites in order search engine finds his site.

Linking from ZeroTalk to an sitemap/indexing page located on other zite may help if someone will develop fullt‚Ç¨xt search ‚Ç¨ngine (not yet developed), but the point is that article names (with maybe even some short description containing keywords) are located inside ZeroTalk database (so these are searchable - can be found when searching ZeroNet connected sites - it is done from within [ZeroHello](/) page).

But you are right regarding the ZeroTalk limit. You can also use this site 0List/this topic to post that "sitemap" as
1. this site has much bigger limit (at least me seeing it under the comment field)
2. this site is among the few of sites that new zeronet members have listed on their ZeroHello and thus it is likely they will open it and it will be included in their zeronet search.

if you will be also linking to particular articles, the "markdown" code is for example:

\[James HOLM / Swaminathan RAMESH - Catalytic Thermal Depolymerisation - ( Plastic to Diesel )\](/1D6QfsBSZHmYWbuCxKG5ya31BiTczoZiES/holmplasticdiesel/holmplasticdiesel.html)

and on the 0list/zerotalk it will look like:

[James HOLM / Swaminathan RAMESH - Catalytic Thermal Depolymerisation - ( Plastic to Diesel )](/1D6QfsBSZHmYWbuCxKG5ya31BiTczoZiES/holmplasticdiesel/holmplasticdiesel.html)
